Pre-Game Insights: The Royals' starting pitcher Cole Ragans had a strong postseason debut and will face the Yankees again in Game 2.
Yankees manager Aaron Boone noted the importance of left-handed batters in the lineup due to the Royals' pitching splits.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees and Royals have a history of competitive matchups, with the Yankees winning five out of seven games in the regular season.
The Royals' offense showed life in Game 1 with key performances, while the Yankees relied on depth and clutch hits.
Others: Game 2 is a critical match in the AL Division Series, with both teams aiming to advance.
